sub_title: Postdoctoral Researcher at DIFFER - Tandem Solar cells, Electrochemistry, Thin-films, PEM-PEC, AEM Hydrogen electrolysers
summary:
I am an exuberant and process-oriented research engineer with a broad background in Nanotechnology, Materials science, and Chemistry. I have strong competences in advanced microfabrication, nanopatterning, CVD, PVD, photolithography, contamination control, plasma cleaning, etching processes. I have acquired these skills driving innovative solutions for complex applications in solar fuel devices for energy, biosensing and MEMS devices for medical applications for the past 5 years.

I’m looking forward to working with a team of scientists, engineers and technicians to develop microfabrication processes for contamination & defect-free advanced semiconductors wafer fabrication, nanoelectronics sensor device and solar PV cells. I’m interested in connecting people and knowledge to create innovations that sustainably strengthen the competitiveness of companies and the well-being of society.
 

Independently initiated and defined new process flows, architectures and platforms, and is technically responsible for the end-to-end development of integral thin film processes and microstructure device, from idea to release for volume manufacturing.

Developed a new type of tandem solar-to-fuel (S2F) device, which showed the best oxide-based photocathode for a generation of hydrogen from sunlight known today. Which consists of 3D Si (PV) microwire arrays covered with copper oxide photoabsorber, which split water into hydrogen (H2) from sunlight.

 Knowledgeable and skilled in the areas of:

♦ Processing semiconductor components in a high-tech cleanroom
♦ Nano-&micro-fabrication Si and photolithography  
♦ Plasma cleaning and Ultra-high Vacuum system
♦ Metrology (XPS, ellipsometry, PL, SEM-EDX, AFM, TEM, XRD, Dektak)
♦ Vacuum deposition (PECVD), and sputtering techniques (PVD, spin-coating)
♦ Doping, Ion implantation, Rapid Thermal Processing
♦ Wet & Dry etching
♦ Thin-film process, Sputtering, spin-coating
♦ DOE and SOP
♦ Electrochemistry & Catalysis
♦ Device fabrication
♦ Characterization of solar PV cells and experience with PV measurement and associated instrumentation (for solid-state devices and (photo-)electrochemical cells) 

#Innovation #Creativity #Science & Technology #LoveMyJob #Challenges #GiveBackToTheSociety

company.name: DIFFER - Dutch Institute for Fundamental Energy Research

profile_positions.company: DIFFER - Dutch Institute for Fundamental Energy Research
profile_positions.description:
"Hydrogen (H2 gas) fuel production from the humidity of ambient air" 

(In collaboration with Toyota Motor Europe)     
The prospect of solar hydrogen as a sustainable energy source is the driving force for the steady progress toward efficient water splitting materials. While current systems run on liquid water, the idea of using water contained in ambient air in a solar water splitting device is very appealing. Capturing water from the air implies that no liquid water is needed for the operation.
profile_positions.title: Postdoctoral Researcher

profile_positions.description: Literature survey on the Qubit research to bringing quantum processors to the ecosystem. Working as a project proposal writer (read and review) for EU projects to kickstart the Quantum startup company.
profile_positions.title: Scientific Researcher

profile_positions.description:
Efforts to build up a stand-alone solar-to-fuel conversion device, the "artificial leaf". Cutting-edge microfabrication techniques, thin-film processes, and nanostructured assemblies were used to develop an artificial photosynthetic system.

•	Responsible for wafer lithography operations in Very-Large-Scale Integration fabrication and optimized the process flow to get high-quality 3D structured silicon.
•	Responsible for the development of process integration flows for microdevices in a structured and methodologically sound way which proved to give defect free and higher efficiency.
•	Investigated in the presence of plasma and gas flow in ultra-high vacuum environment in combination with material interfaces, low level contaminants and small particles.
•	Developed and trained my team members on Lean tools: Pareto charts, process flow charts, reports, data analysis and lead them to identify the root cause of failures by FMEA.
•	Established SOPs for lithography, semiconductor tool cleaning by wet etching & coating process and improved a metal deposition process through DOE.
•	Developed process recipes with plasma cleaning (oxygen, UV-ozone) and HF, RCA cleaning to remove organic contaminations.
•	Obtained knowledge, expertise, and hands-on experience in manufacturing processes using LPCVD/PVD and equipment experience including RF/AC/DC sputtering techniques, e-beam, and thermal evaporators, reactive ion deposition.
•	Identified a problem in the solar-to-fuel device and solved it by advanced designing and achieved beyond 200 h stability with excellent performance. This resulted in the best material for the generation of hydrogen from sunlight known today.
•	Developed and optimized thin film deposition process for various vacuum deposition techniques (sputtering, CVD) proved to give much higher efficiency and better film quality.
profile_positions.title: PHD Candidate

company.name: Jawaharlal Nehru Centre for Advanced Scientific Research, Banaglore

profile_positions.company: Jawaharlal Nehru Centre for Advanced Scientific Research, Banaglore
profile_positions.description:
Nanostructured oxygen reduction electrocatalysts design to reduce Pt dependency of hydrogen fuel cells (HFC). This project involves a good fundamental and practical understanding of theoretical chemistry, analytical chemistry, surface chemistry catalysis, and energy conversion & storage materials.
 
- Systematic rigorous research is planned by using theoretical tools as well as advanced analytical techniques such as AFM, electron microscopy (SEM, TEM), elemental analysis, X-ray diffraction and various optical and in situ advanced spectro-electrochemical methods.
- Based on the understanding gained in the fundamental research, active shape-controlled electrocatalysts are synthesized and tested in high power fuel cells.
- Established the synthesis of tetrahedron Pt nanoparticles with carbon thin-film, which showed high activity, while the onset potential was recorded very high.
- The experimental results showed on robust Pt 2D nanosheets that can be effectively used to tailor morphology of nanomaterials at large scale.
- Developed industry-friendly method for Pt-Pd alloy 1D nanowires and demonstrated significantly higher than previous electrocatalytic investigations.
profile_positions.title: R&D Assistant

profile_positions.description:
The shape-controlled synthesis of Pd and its electrochemical study in acidic electrolyte for the low-temperature fuel cell.
- One of 600 participants selected from a 10000+ -applicant pool of students to engage in a 2-months research program at the premier research institutes.
- Gained knowledge of project management, including excellent problem solving, logistical planning, and communication skills.
- Designed and carried out the experiments using various synthesis methods (like hydrothermal, solvothermal and electrodeposition) to get shape-controlled nanoparticles for low-temperature fuel cells.
- Got hands-on training, experience, and insights on characterizing nanostructures by scanning electron microscopy, XRD, CHI, IR, Raman spectroscopy, XPS, Gas chromatography.
profile_positions.title: Summer Research Student

volunteer_experiences.description: The Chemistry Club is the social organization for students majoring in General chemistry and Organic chemistry or anyone who has an interest in chemistry. Meetings are generally held at least once a month. Our club participates in a number of events and service projects every year, which includes the safe trick-or-treat and performing scientific demonstrations for younger children. The club also holds their own annual industry tour and cultural activities and sports.
